DisplayEnum.description: Suggests how the IdP should display the authentication interface to the user.

PromptEnum.description: Controls whether the IdP should prompt the user for authentication or consent.

GoogleAccessTypeEnum.description: When using a Google social or enterprise (Google Workspace) connection, include this parameter with the value `offline` to be able to refresh access tokens.

AuthorizationParams.title: Authorization Parameters
AuthorizationParams.description: Authorization parameters to be sent to the underlying Identity Provider (IdP) during the authorization request. These parameters influence how the IdP processes the authorization flow and what permissions are requested.

acr_values.description: Specifies the desired Authentication Context Class Reference values, which indicate the required level of authentication (e.g., multi-factor, passwordless). The Identity Provider (IdP) may enforce a specific assurance level based on these values.

audience.description: Defines the intended recipient of the access token, typically indicating who the token is meant for (e.g., an API identifier).

resource.description: Specifies which resource server the client is requesting access to (used in OAuth 2.0 Resource Indicators).

id_token_hint.description: Provides a previously issued id_token to the IdP. It can be used to suggest which user is being authenticated or to facilitate logout requests.

login_hint.description: Supplies a hint about the user's identifier (like an email address or username) to pre-populate the login form.

max_age.description: Indicates the maximum time (in seconds) since the user's last authentication. If exceeded, the IdP forces the user to re-authenticate.

ui_locales.description: Suggests the preferred languages for the user interface, passed as a space-separated list of BCP47 language tags (e.g., 'en', 'es', 'fr').

scope.description: Defines the permissions the client requests from the IdP. Must include standard scopes to identify the user (e.g. 'openid', 'email', 'profile'), scopes required to obtain refresh tokens (e.g. 'offline_access'), and any custom scopes the client needs to access protected resources.

CreateConnectedAccountsRequestContent.description: Request body for creating an account connection request.

connection.description: The name of the connection to link the account with (e.g., 'google-oauth2', 'facebook').

redirect_uri.description: The URI to redirect to after the connection process completes.

state.description: An opaque value used to maintain state between the request and callback.

code_challenge.description: The PKCE code challenge derived from the code verifier.

code_challenge_method.description: The method used to derive the code challenge. Required when code_challenge is provided.

ConnectParams.description: Parameters to be used with the connect URI.

ticket.description: The ticket identifier to be used with the connection URI.

connect_uri.description: The base URI to initiate the account connection flow.

expires_in.description: The number of seconds until the ticket expires.

connect_code.description: The authorization code returned from the connect flow

redirect_uri.description: The redirect URI used in the original request

id.description: The unique identifier of the connected account

created_at.description: ISO date string of when the connected account was created

expires_at.description: ISO date string of when the refresh token expires (optional)

ConnectedAccountAccessTypeEnum.description: The access type for to the connected account.

id.description: The unique identifier for the connected account.

connection.description: The name of the connection associated with the account.

scopes.description: The scopes granted for this connected account.

created_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the connected account was created.

expires_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the connected account expires.

next.description: The token to retrieve the next page of connected accounts (if there is one)

strategy.description: The strategy used by the connection (e.g., 'oauth2', 'oidc').

scopes.description: The available scopes for this connection.

next.description: The token to retrieve the next page of connections (if there is one)

ConnectedAccountId.description: The unique identifier for a connected account

PathAuthenticationMethodId.name: authentication_method_id
PathAuthenticationMethodId.description: Authentication Method ID. This value is part of the Location header returned when creating an authentication method. It should be used as it is, without any modifications.
